intro: Meryta drakeana, commonly known as the Drake's meryta, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its palm-like appearance with a single trunk and broad, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
